heading: webvan to park on wall street
subheading: the ambitious online grocery store needs us$300 million to supply its growing operation. so guess what? an ipo, with goldman sachs underwriting the grocery sacks.
author: wired news report
text: upstart grocery e-tailer webvan will soon deliver to wall street. the company said friday it had filed a registration statement with the securities and exchange commission to sell up to us$300 million of its common stock. webvan will also seek an option for up to $45 million of common stock to be granted to the underwriters to cover over-allotments.see also: webvan's $1 billion soup job- - - - - -the company said it would use proceeds from its ipo to build and supply equipment for distribution centers and for general corporate purposes, including working capital.in late june, the company opened a $42 million, 330,000-square-foot distribution center in oakland, california. webvan predicts it will sell $300 million a year in groceries, including 25,000 varieties of wine. the latter, though, may be affected by bills now moving through congress that aim to limit sales of alcohol over the net.peapod, the company's primary competitor, opened its own 60,000-square-foot distribution center on 1 june, after opting out of its contract with safeway.goldman, sachs & co. will underwrite the webvan offering.
